channel.title: Bash on Software engineering and reverse
channel.description: Recent content in Bash on Software engineering and reverse

item.title: Killing a process started by IntelliJ Using Unlogged SDK
item.description: ps aux | grep java | grep unlogged-sdk- | grep -v grep | awk '{print $2}' | xargs kill -9 This is a command that can be used to identify and terminate Java processes that are using the UnLogged SDK library in Linux. Here’s an explanation of each part of the command: ps aux: lists all currently running processes on the system, along with their process ID (PID), user ID, CPU usage, memory usage, and other relevant information.
